2019

Datafest April 6-7
2nd Prize, Best Data Visualization
Collaborators: Subash Chebolu, Ankit Deogharia, Joe McCormick, and Ryan Williamson
OHI/O Hackathon November 2-3
Ripple
Collaborators: James Finefrock, Joshua Miller, and Mitchell Giese

2018

Datafest April 7-8
1st Prize, Best Use of Outside Data
Collaborators: Subash Chebolu and Ankit Deogharia

Analyzed over 2.8 Gb of Indeed.com job data, containing more than 17 million rows, as well as several outside data sets (cost of living, physical wellness, etc) to create a map of ecomonic utility across the United States.

OHI/O Hackathon October 27-28
1st Prize, JPMorgan Chase Natural Disaster Challenge
Collaborators: James Finefrock, Joshua Miller, and Mitchell Giese

Designed an Android app that utilized peer to peer wifi connections to allow communication among survivors and with first responders in natural disaster situations. Companion web application allows responders to use collected data to coordinate recovery efforts. There were 22 other teams that competed in the challenge.

2017

OHI/O Hackathon October 21-22
1st Prize, Eaton Nameplate Challenge
Collaborators: Michael Braun, James Finefrock, and Mitchell Giese

Designed an Android app which recognized and parse text from Eaton product nameplates to populate data fields for Eaton technicians.

2016

OHI/O Hackathon November 19-20
Battlecheckers
Collaborators: James Finefrock, Joshua Miller, and RJ Wynn

Designed and published an Android game, Battle Checkers. Prior to the event, none of us had ever done any mobile app development.

Earlier

US Patent #9010653: Erasable Barcode April 21, 2015
Patent
Collaborators: Ananya Rajagopal, Peter Glaubitz, Lucienne Paradis, Nathan Sears, Abhimanyu Singhal, Edwin Glaubitz, Arjun Kumar, Rahul Mal, and David Feng

Device that prevents the sale of improperly stored perishable items by invalidating the product’s barcode. Designed for our project in the FIRST Lego League 2012 season, Food Factor, when all of us were in middle school.
